title: Computer screen goes black after champion select
body:
When I open my League of Legends client and start a game after champion select my computer screen goes black and forces me to restart my computer. Sometimes it works fine but sometimes it doesn't and it is pissing me off. I get 60 frames in each game and a bit of lag sometimes, I know my computer can handle it but I don't know why it happens. Any help can be appreciated. I have spent way too much money to stop playing the game and would like help to fix it.

~Krimsonic

replies.body:
If you're on Windows 10, this is likely caused by the Windows Game Bar and its *Game DVR* feature. I recommend [disabling the bar entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves this.

Let me know if it did.

I tried disabling it and it worked. The only problem is that after the match the screen went black for no reason and forced me to restart again. Is there any fix to this?

~Krimsonic

It sounds like this may be a poor interaction with your display driver. I recommend working through our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) since it covers some really good steps to resolve this.

Shoot me an update when you've finished that guide.
